### getClobberingMemoryAccess() {#ad0de4d92d12aba524bd8ea3eac01a24a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MemoryAccess &#42; llvm::MemorySSA::SkipSelfWalker::getClobberingMemoryAccess (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults">BatchAAResults</a> &amp; AA)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Does the same thing as <a href="#a9da2890c2f44bf0d822421285e9331b6">getClobberingMemoryAccess(const Instruction &#42;I)</a>, but takes a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> instead of an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssa-cpp/#l01075">1075</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssa-cpp">MemorySSA.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getClobberingMemoryAccess() {#a436216f6ed38b7dc7a985eb697ea63f0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MemoryAccess &#42; llvm::MemorySSA::SkipSelfWalker::getClobberingMemoryAccess (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &amp;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults">BatchAAResults</a> &amp; AA)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Given a potentially clobbering memory access and a new location, calling this will give you the nearest dominating clobbering <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> (by skipping non-aliasing def links).

This version of the function is mainly used to disambiguate phi translated pointers, where the value of a pointer may have changed from the initial memory access. Note that this expects to be handed either a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryuse">MemoryUse</a>, or an already potentially clobbering access. Unlike the above API, if given a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydef">MemoryDef</a> that clobbers the pointer as the starting access, it will return that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydef">MemoryDef</a>, whereas the above would return the clobber starting from the use side of the memory def.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssa-cpp/#l01080">1080</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssa-cpp">MemorySSA.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getClobberingMemoryAccess() {#a2783df47072c5951e94299a35bc39848}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MemoryAccess &#42; llvm::MemorySSAWalker::getClobberingMemoryAccess (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults">BatchAAResults</a> &amp; AA)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Given a memory Mod/Ref/ModRef&#39;ing instruction, calling this will give you the nearest dominating <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> that Mod&#39;s the location the instruction accesses (by skipping any def which <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aa">AA</a> can prove does not alias the location(s) accessed by the instruction given).

Note that this will return a single access, and it must dominate the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a>, so if an operand of a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryphi">MemoryPhi</a> node Mod&#39;s the instruction, this will return the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryphi">MemoryPhi</a>, not the operand. This means that given: if (a) &#123; 1 = MemoryDef(liveOnEntry) store a &#125; else &#123; 2 = MemoryDef(liveOnEntry) store b &#125; 3 = MemoryPhi(2, 1) MemoryUse(3) load a

calling this API on load(a) will return the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryphi">MemoryPhi</a>, not the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydef">MemoryDef</a> in the if (a) branch.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssa-cpp/#l01063">1063</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssa-cpp">MemorySSA.cpp</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssa-h/#l01045">1045</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssa-h">MemorySSA.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getClobberingMemoryAccess() {#a71362ef59d62d38c5a5719770282d756}

<MemberDefinition

### invalidateInfo() {#af6b567bc09d96e972d2f2636374a8bd7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::MemorySSA::SkipSelfWalker::invalidateInfo (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryaccess">MemoryAccess</a> &#42;)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Given a memory access, invalidate anything this walker knows about that access.

This API is used by walkers that store information to perform basic cache invalidation. This will be called by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssa">MemorySSA</a> at appropriate times for the walker it uses or returns.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssa-cpp/#l01087">1087</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memoryssa-cpp">MemorySSA.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
